alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 1:31AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Pine, southeastern St. Louis, eastern Carlton, southwestern Lake and northwestern Douglas Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 130 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Boulder Lake, to near City of Rice Lake, to Thomson, to near Nemadji, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Superior and City of Rice Lake around 135 AM CDT. Oliver and French River around 145 AM CDT. Foxboro, Knife River and Stoney Point around 150 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Two Harbors, Larsmont and South Range. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Minnesota.
